text: So I've made some templates for emails using HTML + HubL that come with Drag and Drop zones and modules pre-configured. They're basically placeholders for non-technical staff to modify, move, replace, etc as they see fit, though we want to try and frontload as much of the design work as possible. One thing that's a little irritating is that I noticed when you're making emails in the "Email" section of the dashboard, there's a "Style" tab where some padding is applied to the modules by default. Is there a way to make that disabled by default in the template? I didn't see anything in the documentation that would let me.
Hey <@U07MAGZJL0Y> - the style-tab and padding is something you can't turn off in email modules since it's getting added by HubSpot automatically
Well that's annoying. Guess we'll just have to let the email builders know about that.
Hey <@U022YD6LGAU> just checking in to see if you've had a minute yet to find that code snippet to open the form redirects in a new tab please?
